qas.question: Which political forces maintained strong control over the state until shortly after French intervention?
The intervention had serious consequences for which state?
Who made an effort to organize a strong defense against the French?
Who assigned the First Battalion of Chihuahua for integration into the army?
To where was the battalion first deployed?

context: The <a0_0>liberal<a0_0/> political forces maintained strong control over the state government until shortly after the French Intervention which turned the tables in favor to the conservative forces once again. The intervention had serious repercussions for the state of <a1_0>Chihuahua<a1_0/>. <a2_0>President Juárez<a2_0/>, in an effort to organize a strong defense against the French, decreed a list of national guard units that every state had to contribute to the Ministry of War and the Navy; Chihuahua was responsible for inducting 2,000 men. Regaining power, <a3_0>Governor Luis Terrazas<a3_0/> assigned the First Battalion of Chihuahua for integration into the national army led by General Jesús González Ortega; the battalion was deployed to <a4_0>Puebla<a4_0/>. After the defeat of the army in Puebla, the Juárez administration was forced to abandon Mexico City; the president retreated further north seeking refuge in the state of Chihuahua.
